website_summaries.verdict: An electric edger that cuts a clean line along concrete boundaries as well as cleaning up or creating garden beds and borders.
pros: Spring assist front wheel for variable blade depth.Cord lock mechanism helps keep extension cord plugged in while in use
cons: Some users have not been happy with the durability and quality of the guard

website_summaries.verdict: Corded edger makes quick work of curbside and driveway edging, and creating and cleaning garden borders.
pros: Spring-assist front wheel controls blade depth
Edges around sidewalks, driveways, paved areas, garden beds, and other borders
cons: Blade and motor might not hold up

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful 12 amp motor and double-edged blade to prevent wear highlight the benefits of this model with integrated cord-lock technology.
pros: The front wheel has a built-in spring to assist users in varying the cutting depth
At any depth, the motor is powerful enough to cut through most thicknesses of grass
Lightweight and easy to maneuver for curved cuts
Cord and extension cord lock together
cons: Without curb-hopper technology, using this model over uneven or rough terrain may cause slightly uneven cuts

website_summaries.verdict: A good, basic electric edger, though not as robust and versatile as some high-end competitors.
pros: 12-amp motor delivers plenty of power for all-around edge maintenance
cons: A few owners report component quality issues

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power, not durable
customer_reviews.text: So firstly, this is not a powerful tool. IE if your grass is very overgrown or you want to only edge 2x a year it will be a decent amount of work with this, which can be nerve racking when the blade finally cuts through the bunched up sod. You'll likely have to go at it twice once at a higher level, given the price there are better products out there. My review does not reflect this, however as with some of the other reviews, mine also broke the first time I used it. The front wheel broke (not came off, broke).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the aeroETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is Awful
customer_reviews.text: We have used this edge for a year now, it has done an OK job. This past Saturday the blade stopped spinning. The motor appears to be ceased up. I have attempted to wall GreenWorks for customer support and 3 different times I have been on hold for 20 minutes or more. WHAT A JOKE.
customer_reviews.author: 6KBSTay

customer_reviews.title: Its a pretty good value...
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine delivered and am already done doing about 120' of combined sidewalk and driveway. Took an hour tops. I really like it. Better than my edgehog by Black and Decker;which lasted me 10 years. If this lasts 10 years,Ill be happy. I do my edge Once in spring and once in the fall. Cut about 2' deep. Good deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Needs A Thinner Blade
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed in this. It is a good, well made product don't get me wrong. I was a professional landscaper for 15 years. Because of that I have a lot of hand issues and I can no longer start my gas powered equipment. Since I retired I am trying to go electric because of that. This has the potential to work, but I think it really needs a thinner blade to work optimally. Did OK along my sidewalk, but not so good along a flower bed that had overgrown somewhat. Might work OK to keep a freshly edged bed in shape, but don't expect it to work miracles if it's already ahead of you.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Bad plastic guard
customer_reviews.text: The edger itself works good only problem is the plastic guard around the blade. The plastic pins under the guard that the screws go into broke off. tried to glue only lasted 5 minutes and broke off again. I ended up gluing the whole cover solid down to the machine so far its working. BAD Design. A lot to be said for gorilla glue it works better than the guard.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Webb

customer_reviews.title: Solid device. Must have if you cut your own grass!
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into our first home. Was a bit confused on how to put the device together but after reading the instructions it was quick and easy. What’s funny is I just purchased their lawn mower and mowed the lawn the day before. Couldn’t get into the house edges of the home. This will definitely help us solve this problem. If this review was useful, please click yes below :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N

customer_reviews.title: Chews Rather Than Cut
customer_reviews.text: I find it awkward, heavy and it doesn't cut a smooth finish. The edge looks like it has been chewed. There has been no clean edge at all, any time I have used it. I don't like it at all. The handle was difficult to put together and cannot be adjust for different height people. Not every gardner is a 6' muscular type. I am older and not muscular. If this sounds like you, try some other edger. I had read a lot of good reviews and kept wondering what I was doing wrong. I wan't doing anything wrong. It just doesn't work. Now I have a useless tool taking up valuable .
customer_reviews.author: Picky Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great company name, they just missed it with this product
customer_reviews.text: My trusty B&D edger called the quits after ~10 yrs. I decided to go for the GreenWorks edger as I love their battery operated hedge trimmer. However, this product did not meet my expectations. It lacks a metal shield between the blade and the concrete sidewalk/driveway. Because of this, the blade constantly hit the concrete. When it does it vibrates harshly up the handle really bothering your hands even with gloves. Also, because of this, I would expect the blade to last long either. I went back to a new B&D edger.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pad

customer_reviews.title: Extreme kick-back!
customer_reviews.text: I typically like Greenworks products, but this is a tremendous hazard! The extreme kick-back strained my neck & threw my back out. It damaged my sidewalk and ruined sprinkler heads. And, it does a terrible job of edging!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Edges cleanly and is powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This edger arrived safe and sound and was easy to assemble - took about 5-10 minutes. This is nice workhorse - edges cleanly and has plenty of power. I had thought of getting a cordless edge so I wouldn't have to mess around with an extension cord. But, I'm glad I got the corded version. The power is there, and the extension cord really hasn't been an issue or as bothersome as I thought it would be. Also, i thought about getting an edger that uses a fiber instead of a blade. Glad I got the blade - looks like it will last a long time. Very happy with this edger.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The soil will stuck in the guard
customer_reviews.text: I have not used other edger before , this was my first one . The design is pretty nice, and easy to work with . But I have notice that during edging , the soil( if wet or moist ) will get compacted inside the guard , which will stop the rotation of the blade . The compacted soil is rather hard to remove and I have to clean the guard about 4-5 times at least during edging .
customer_reviews.author: Swagddady

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: It's an affordable electric edge trimmer. Its doesn't have the high power a gas trimmer would, but it still gets the job done. Half my front yard edges were overgrown by a couple of inches. I went over the edges once at a high height setting, and the edger cut through the earth and grass just fine. Went over it a second time at a deeper setting to trench the edges a little deeper. Had no problems lining up the blade, binding, or catching on anything. Now that the edges are cut, it will be a lot easier to maintain them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Grant A Hopwood

customer_reviews.title: no usable tool includef
customer_reviews.text: This edger works fine. I had to take off one star for the useless tool that was included. I had to use my own adjustable wrench instead. There is a little kickback when you first start it up, but after that, none. There is also no splash of stones or dirt to the back or out the side. Warning though: if the ground is at all wet, the mud will cake up inside the blade well pretty often. I found that a small hand weeder gets the mud out fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Pat.

customer_reviews.title: Great edger.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I didn't know what I was doing at first and it was a disaster. I stepped back and educated myself and love the results. I love the depth adjustment option. I use this on a yard with no curb, so it is a challenge to get a straight edge, but this did the job! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Lady

customer_reviews.title: Easy Edger
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this a 4 star because it does not have an edge guide other than that I highly recommend. I bought this for my daughter, but I am the one that has to use it and it works really good. She has a corner lot and I was using a string trimmer to edge the sidewalk curb and driveway and it took forever. This mad the job really easy and it only took me about 15 min vs about 45 min.
customer_reviews.author: Tropiks7

customer_reviews.title: Superior edger with cravats
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine in 2014. Edge the drive, sidewalk, walkways and street with iton a rotating basis with mowing the lawn. The machine has worked flawlessly since day one. The cravat is this: the owners manual/service guide contains many inaccuracies and misinformation. Thankfully the exploded view schematic is accurate. If you can live with that (and obviously I can), it is far and away the best edger I have used. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Love the greenworks products
customer_reviews.text: I have a few things by greenworks now and this was a great addition to my yard care kit. I was using a weedeater for edging but dangit it too sooo long because the stupid line kept breaking. This eats through grass and dirt no problem and has greatly improved the look of my hard in half the time. The blades are inexpensive and easy to replace too.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Plastic blade guard broke off
customer_reviews.text: Was actually looking for another edger to replace this one and noticed this was still available. I wanted to see if anyone had the same problem I did. I don't edge every week, maybe three times during the summer, and I don't have a lot of edging to do, sidewalk and driveway only. In the fourth year of ownership and less than a dozen uses, the plastic blade guard broke off. This not only makes the edger unusable, it creates a safety situation. I've been using my Stihl weed trimmer since, but it's not the easiest way to edge a lawn. So looking for another one now.
customer_reviews.author: Strat

customer_reviews.title: Get a professional looking lawn today
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a different brand edger for years. My wife bought this as a replacement (I was skeptical since I was loyal to the other one) and I’m definitely impressed with the results. My lawn looks likes its professionally done!
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item back in June and it went out on me in August. Don't even bother contacting customer service because you won't get anyone to answer the phone. I also purchased a string trimmer from this company around the same time and it has given me the same issue, therefore I don't recommend the product or the company.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfTwoWithAutism

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite surprised as to how easy this is the use. It does a good job with staying in line with the edge. With frequent use, I'm sure I can get a deeper cut. For the first cut in a long time, I'm very satisfied with the job this edger created. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Always used gas edgers. This is my first elect. edger. Works Great, Easy assembly. smooth and does not sound like a skill saw running on a hard board. Does a great job and you don't have to worry about carburetors failing with the bad ethanol gas etc. no maintenance. Kinda of a pain dragging the extension cord around but it's better than pulling a start rope on something that won't start when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: stub

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for edging around flower beds & retaining wall
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using this tool for the past two weeks. He is very pleased with it. It is a great tool for the price and so far it has more than paid for itself as our gardener would have charge twice as much as the tool to do the edging my husband has done so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Zachariasen

customer_reviews.title: Impressive product!
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at the power this edger has. It did a great job first time out. Compacted ground does require the operator to move slowly. And dang, for less than a hundred bucks I’ll deal with the hassle of an electrical cord (or 2 or 3).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for flowerbeds
customer_reviews.text: This is not for use on lawns around flowerbeds it’s just a sidewalk edger.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Erlanger

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, bad performance, bad idea,Don't buy it, is useless!
customer_reviews.text: What a joke. You better use it for wine grape press making. It turns so slowly that will put you to sleep. The protecting guard obscures your vision on where to place the unit. The handler beam totally non ergonomic.The cutting element should be smaller, sharper, and spin way faster, as the gas one the pros use. Where is the design brain of the Green Works team at?. Total waste of money. Don't buy it, useless.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Del Guercio

customer_reviews.title: Great for 63 year old grandmother
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but I used to have a Black & Decker which was easier to handle. No sure why, but this is harder to run smoothly beside concrete without hitting the concrete; Hard to tell exactly where the blade is going. I'm only 5' so maybe I'm just not tall enough. I'm 63 & this is very easy for me to use. Have tried using gas weed eaters & just too much trouble for me. Also tried battery powered but I end up cussing out all battery powered equipment. I burned up the battery on a Ryobi edger after 3 uses. Good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This edger worked better than any of the other brands I have had in the past. I have bought and used the Black & Decker brand replacement blades for about $7 at Lowe's that fit and work great. Can not find the GreenWorks blades in my area and don't want to pay a lot of money for something that' going to wear out very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cheden

customer_reviews.title: Good edger
customer_reviews.text: Works well to edge around our driveway and sidewalk. Has plenty of power. My wife used it for the first time and was able to do the edging.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L. Carsner

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about this edger. Works great. Easy to use. My only complaint is it's not balanced very well and falls over easily when not using it. Not a deal breaker. I've used it two times with no problems and the edges look great.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Law

customer_reviews.title: I found this hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Sidewalks were very overgrown, and I found this difficult to use because of that. Would have appreciated a video, or even just a book on how to use
customer_reviews.author: bookhooker

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this edger to anyone buying one. Easy to assemble, easy to use. Do a great job edging. Very powerful for an electric edger. Very satisfied. Two 👍🏻 thumbs up from Cleveland.
customer_reviews.author: ItaliaMyVine

customer_reviews.title: Whale of an edger
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance on a neglected old sidewalk, ready to go out of the box with very simple assembly!! This edger is an incredible value for the money,not sure why one would use a manual edger after using this powerful unit
customer_reviews.author: Boyne River

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Edging
customer_reviews.text: I am tired of using thread based trimmer convertible Edger, it will consume too much of thread/wire with not a good looking edging. This Greenworks 12 Amp Corded Edger is perfect for my home needs, straight and clean edging, and very easy to use, I am not a professional but still I am able to use it day 1 with out any issues. Loved this product and good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: CNM Kumar Reddy

customer_reviews.title: A Little Weighty
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for my first ever edger. Only complaint is the head has weight to it and I wish it was more light weight if it could be made that way. I use it weekly, and plan to keep going with it. Does a great job on my bermuda yard
customer_reviews.author: Les Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Nice Edger
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made edger. Great features. It works well. I would not call this unit light weight. Pretty heavy duty. Lots of power.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this one first
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought it when my b&d edger failed. Works great and is easier than my old one to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Weldin

customer_reviews.title: Green Works 110V edger
customer_reviews.text: Never owned an electric edger before, never even owned a gas one. Got tired of the old manual push type. Guess I'm getting older or smarter. This edger works great and leaves my driveway neat and clean looking. There is a guild you need to keep to the right of the driveway. Once in a while I hit the concrete and see sparks. The unit is fairly light and has no vibration. If you have a long driveway make sure you purchase a long ext. cord and KEEP the cord away from the blade. I would recommend this brand and the price on amazon was the clincher.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a pro did it.
customer_reviews.text: A very nice edger. Well built, powerful, does a nice job. What else do you want? Greenworks is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a solid edger. Extra dirt gets stuck up in the guard and i have to clean it every 20 feet or so but that probably is because i don’t edge very often. Again I’m sure it’s not the best one out there but for the price it does the job for a standard driveway and sidewalk
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Eric Cornellier

customer_reviews.title: From weed eater to easy trimming
customer_reviews.text: Easy to direct along the sidewalk and trims beautifully. Has a very nice targeting device to allow for perfect trim jobs. There’s nothing like a clean straight trim line😎
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Potts

customer_reviews.title: Great edger
customer_reviews.text: Great edger for the price. It’s light and very easy to use. Cuts the edges of the grass very well!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah H

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad edger for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s just ok. Had a gas edger for years and loved it. But I have a small yard now and don’t need a gas one. It seems to work ok for the money but not nearly as good as a gas edger. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and true
customer_reviews.text: Great edger. If your soil is wet at all there is a tendency for the mud to clog up in your blade shroud. Carry a screwdriver to dig the mud out occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Erlu

customer_reviews.title: Quit edging by hand!
customer_reviews.text: It's so fantastic having an edger. Much better than doing this work manually. Although I don't have any experience with any others, this edger seems to have plenty of power and I'm pleased to add it to my collection of GreenWorks tools.
customer_reviews.author: RyWalters

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: don't think this was a used or re furbished item. not a scratch on it, looked brand new. for the money, it was worth the wait time to get it.
customer_reviews.author: ham bone

customer_reviews.title: Get that garden edge
customer_reviews.text: For when you need that deep edge and the string trimmer ain’t cutting it. My edge was over grown and dirt was on the sidewalk. This will clear that up.
customer_reviews.author: Rainier

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, high cost for replacement blade
customer_reviews.text: I'm a GreenWorks fan, but there are better options than this product. The bulky GreenWorks edger is top-heavy and often falls over in the garage. Plus, the replacement blades are FAR too expensive. I still own this, but I bought a Worx trimmer/Edger/Mini-mower, and that's what I use for my edging now while my GreenWorks edger sits alone collecting dust. :(
customer_reviews.author: William Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The worst product possible. Won't cut the grass on the edge. Just awful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hate hate hate
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this thing. But I hated it. It was a hassle to put together because the holes for the screws were not cut properly. Had to end up using a hammer to hit the screws in. Didn't work properly. Thank god for returns!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra M.

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased gasoline powered edgers but I decided that I was done with pulling starter cords. My old edger broke last year so the grass was thick over the sidewalk. This edger powered right through it. I have only used it once but I am quite impressed. It was easy to set up and easy to use. Update: 5/3/15 I have used this for a year now and still very happy with it. I will never go back to a gasoline powered edger.
customer_reviews.author: tberry

customer_reviews.title: looks great csnt wat to use it
customer_reviews.text: im sure it works just cant get any one of these men out there to do it yet
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H

customer_reviews.title: and the motor has good power. The blade works well
customer_reviews.text: So far no issues. The correct extension chord rating is being used, and the motor has good power. The blade works well. Easy to handle. Only negative is the blade shield fills up with dirt, especially when it's damp, and you need to stop, unplugged, then run your finger through the inside of the shield to push the dirt out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work just fine. I don't have much sidewalk at the house, so I have to practice going around my flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: brianfssc

customer_reviews.title: Walk way edged
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, easy to assemble ready to use in minutes... I recommend this unit .
customer_reviews.author: Chuck & Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Finally a real edger with a powerful motor and metal blade and easy to maneuver on the curb. No clumsy adjusting or loud gas engine. Using a cord isn't bad, but I do wish it had a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, dependable edger.
customer_reviews.text: I love this edger! It was easy to set up and it works great. I prefer electric tools to gas ones, and this one works quite well. We had never edged our lawn before, but this tool did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mel & Freddi

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: We considered getting a much more expensive edger, but because this was our first experience with a bladed rather than corded edger, we decided to spend less at the outset. We have used it 5 times so far and it works just as expected and hoped for. There is a learning curve in adjusting the height of the blade and knowing how close you can get to a curb, but that is no surprise. So far, so good. Time will tell if it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Ichabod

customer_reviews.title: Great beastly little edger
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for performance. I've run it pretty hard on some tough spots and its done very well for the designed and specified power expectations. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Mebobbob

customer_reviews.title: excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: All the green works product I've purchased , without exception, have been exemplary. I highly recommend this product particularly if one is not adept at edging with the weed eater. However, I 've used this product to dig trenches for rain water and it's performed well.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and ges the job done!  Good price too.
customer_reviews.text: It works well, is easy to use and gets the job done.. I wish that I started buying Greenworks earlier and had their other tools and not what I have been using. The price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Save your back, buy an electric.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! I wish I bought this a few years ago. Quality seems very good. I was impressed, but to be honest, I wasn't expecting much as I wasn't familiar with this item before I purchsed it. Only reason I took a star was because it does get a bit of build up between the blade and the housing, which is hard to clean. I would certainly recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Burns

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks is the best  !!
customer_reviews.text: no more lawn gas products... my tools for all lawn products are now Greenworks... starts first time every time... does a great job edging and is plenty powerful enough for my yard area
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sidewalks and curbs
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it on edging garden beds yet, but it works like a champ on my sidewalk and curb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Rips right along
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today. There was some assembly.... that should have taken about 2 minutes. After about 5 minutes, I got the nylon sleeve rotated correctly so that I could fasten the handle down correctly. Performance of this unit is excellent. Absolutely no issue hacking through the grass at the concrete edge of the driveway. 25 minutes of manual labor was about 5 minutes with this tool. We have this nasty crabgrass-type stuff (zoysia?) and it just tore through that junk. I'll do the rest of the job when it cools down outside but this tool looks to be a winner.....
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Edging All Day
customer_reviews.text: Listen, you feel like a big man don't you, looking to cut up some grass to get it away from you cement. Well this is the product for you! It's affordable and it does what you need it to do. I suggest getting the ground a little wet when you edge. It's going to help. It a little clunky movement wise though.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: The lawn edger does an excellent job of edging our lawn. It's easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Janet W. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: GreenWorks Dud
customer_reviews.text: Buying this edger was a big mistake. This edger is a heart attack waiting to happen. It's heavy and difficult to control. Edging a straight line is nearly impossible. I tried to remove the blade to sharpen it and it and I could not do it. It appeared to be frozen in place. You will want to consider the 100ft of cord to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Brasken

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It took me a second to get it, but when I did, I was rolling. The only thing i didn't like was stopping to clean off the mud . That was a bit of an headache. I would advise to practice on a section of the yard where no one can see first.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Caught fire after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this edger but after only using it a handful of times, the bloody thing caught fire!! so disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Mitrovic Keats

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this is hopes that it would at least meet my expectations,but it fails miserably!!! It is too light weight and tips over easily. There is no sidewalk edger guide to stay inside the sidewalk. It jumps all over the place. If you lower the blade too much it stalls. When I first tried to use it the blade nut came undone and the blade just spun around not doing anything. I had to stop and tighten the blade nut three times. I would never buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Share A. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I have a corded electric mower, so when the mowing is done, I use the same cord for this edger, which mitigates the issue of using a cord for the edger. It is easy to line up the cutter to the edge of the sidewalk and make a clean pass.
customer_reviews.author: George Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: this machine run good, but the blade is not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: this machine run good, but the blade is not strong enough, u might need to change the blade every 3 months maybe, good luck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Relatively simple to put together. Seems sturdy. I'm using it on my own lawn. I'm at a corner house so I have quite a lot of edging. It worked well. I'm happy with the product so far.
customer_reviews.author: deetroit

customer_reviews.title: Great edger
customer_reviews.text: It is kind of heavy for me (female) when using it for long periods of time. It does a great job. Putting it together I had to use a hammer to put the metal bolts through the holes to assemble the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Edger
customer_reviews.text: Almost as good as old gas powered edgers, has trouble with thick way over grown bits but with a second pass it gets it
customer_reviews.author: B Ran

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's intended to do, but in the end, I prefer a string trimmer for my edging to this. Just personal preference. One product complaint is how difficult it was to change the blade. Something that should have taken me a minute or two ended up taking about a half hour of struggling.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zuccaro

customer_reviews.title: Woks great, nice clean cut and I am not having ...
customer_reviews.text: Woks great, nice clean cut and I am not having to recharge the batteries all the time. Much nicer cut and look using this than the wed waker. You can't use this along a black top driveway as the edges are not even. It
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Great edger
customer_reviews.text: Great edger at a great price. I use it twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Electric Edger
customer_reviews.text: I like its grip, but it collects dirt (ours has lots of clay in it) inside the blade guard that has to be cleaned out every 4-5 feet
customer_reviews.author: Moriancumer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm - I was able to edge all the sidewalks and curbs and driveway lickety split. Most of my time was spent rearranging my cords due to the landscaping between the outlets and the edges to be trimmed. I definitely recommend this one over my previous gas powered edger
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Mc

customer_reviews.title: Nice Electric Edger for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my worn-out Sears electric edger. The thick grass we have here in South East Texas gives an edger a pretty good workout, but the Greenworks seems up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: happy edger😊
customer_reviews.text: once you get the hang of it, it's like cutting butter. the edge looks like a you just cut a piece of cake. love love it. can't wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: mary ragland

customer_reviews.title: The unit is a bit flimsy at the front so ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a bit flimsy at the front so it takes effort to keep it on task in the correct position . Also, it doesn't cut at all through overgrown edging jobs . With today's technology I expected more .
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. The only Greenworks tool that I own and dislike and I own all of them. It doesn't cut straight and it destroys your edges.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Greenworks Lawn Edger for about two months ago and I love it. So what if the cord is a little bit of an inconvenience but its no more of an inconvenience than going to the gas station, storing and mixing fuel, making a mess on string trimmer etc, etc. I leave the Lawn Edger at its deepest setting and it always cuts a clean, neat trench next to the sidewalk. It Does Not throw rocks and dirt backwards or far away in front as some might suggest. It will not replace a string trimmer for the jobs around trees so I will be ordering an electric Greenworks string trimmer soon..
customer_reviews.author: James M. Dunnam

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great!
customer_reviews.text: Although it has a sight guide to keep in line with an edge I do wish it has a guide next to the blade so that the blade will last longer. It does work great though!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rager

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Edger
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and use. I've never used an edger so I have nothing to gauge against but this edger worked great. It cleaned up the edges of my yard very nicely which is pretty impressive because I had allowed the edges to get out of control! I'm only 4'11" so being able to adjust the length of the shaft was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Duke

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. Get's a little clogged up where we are with clay, but the motor has kept going after getting the clay cleaned out. Light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Edger
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a cheap Sears 2-cycle edger that worked one season.They don't sell carb. parts to this motor, so I trashed that junk. This edger is very powerful and hardly knows it cutting.
customer_reviews.author: EngineerinMe

customer_reviews.title: Tried two had to return both
customer_reviews.text: The first one worked for about 70 feet of side walk and motor froze. They were very quick in replacement however the replacement had the same issue the elect motor just stopped running and just hummed. Did not replace this time returned and AMOZON was very quick in issuing the full refund.
customer_reviews.author: CHET COX

customer_reviews.title: floor models or gently used product!
customer_reviews.text: While this product does work great, it went together easy, and overall I am somewhat satisfied with the product. This product gets one star because it was clearly used and returned before it was shipped to me. As you'll see pie the pictures there are scratches scuffs and dings on a part that should be brand-new. It is unacceptable to be listing products as new when they are clearly floor models or gently used products!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I think that I probably should have just gotten the ...
customer_reviews.text: I think that I probably should have just gotten the push kind. this is not a stellar piece of yard equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Mckaren1

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy and does not cut as deep as I would like but works fine
customer_reviews.author: willie

customer_reviews.title: Okay after modifying
customer_reviews.text: It has about as much power as you can expect from an electric edger. It bogs down or completely stops on hard or super wet ground. The guard constantly got clogged with dirt and stopped the blade. I ended up cutting the outside guard off with tin snips and it works 10x's better. No more clogging and you can actually see the placement of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Works great, acceptable price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, acceptable price, got it late in the season, so didn't give it much opportunity to break though. We'll see next Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: For the price is a good equipment. Ligth easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Esy to use, works well
customer_reviews.text: The edger works well and is not hard to use. It is easy to change blades and adjust the depth. I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Dave Williams

customer_reviews.title: not a bad unit so far....
customer_reviews.text: a bit hard to see the curb in front of you -- there could be a better guide visible on the unit -- overall unit worked well for the purpose I bought it for - also bought a handheld edger tool to followup the cut with - have to be careful how close you get to your sprinkler system or you will hit the head & destroy it -- for the small, once & a while job I will use it for - the unit will work fine -- only used it once so far to do the initial dig which was difficult - re-use should be easier now that the 1st hole cuts have been made.
customer_reviews.author: john randy Zawislak

customer_reviews.title: Nice edger
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice edger, but a bear to put together. Handle holes didn't line up. Once I got it together and used it for the first time, it did a good job edging. It is not a powerful as my old Black & Decker edger.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

product_meta.title: Greenworks 12 Amp Electric Corded Edger 27032
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The GreenWorks products that you purchase have a ZERO carbon footprint. We'll say that again - our entire product line will never release an ounce of carbon emission into the air. 4 Year Warranty - Double The Industry Standard. When looking for lawn tools, we know you're thinking about quality. You're looking for something that will get the job done and get you back to your weekend. That's why GreenWorks backs every tool with a full four-year warranty - we know our products will perform at the highest level and always be reliable. GreenWorks high quality products are manufactured to last. That's why we back every product with a warranty that's twice the industry standard. We'll provide all the power you need without polluting the air or forcing you to keep hauling your gas can to the nearest station (especially in the middle of a mow). No more tune-ups or maintenance. No more emissions. Fifty-four million Americans mow their lawns every weekend, according to the EPA, using 800 million gallons of gas each year. Along the way, homeowners spill more than 17 million gallons of gas while refueling. That's equivalent to the 1989 Exxon Valdez disaster. It's time to move beyond clumsy, harmful gas-powered mowers. It's time for GreenWorks to be your lawn tools for life.
feature_bullets: 12 Amp motor delivers powerful edging capabilities
7.5" double edged blade provides robust edging capabilities and longer wear
Spring assist front wheel provides variable blade depth
Adjustable auxiliary handle for added user comfort and control
Integrated cord lock feature prevents accidental disconnect

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars572 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
